sentence1: The very first night after he went to it his mistress asked him if he would go over the hill to the house of a neighbour and borrow a sieve.

sentence2: They all stopped their various employments when Farquhar came suddenly down in their midst.

sentence2: They looked at him in alarm.

sentence2: But Farquhar, being very fond of dancing, and being in no wise anxious to be seated, thought that he would like to have a reel first.

sentence2: He asked the Fairies if he might join them.

sentence2: And they, although they looked surprised at his request, allowed him to do so.

sentence1: And they, although they looked surprised at his request, allowed him to do so.
sentence2: In a few minutes the young man was dancing away as gaily as any of them.

sentence1: In a few minutes the young man was dancing away as gaily as any of them.
sentence2: And as he danced a strange change came over him.

sentence1: And as he danced a strange change came over him.
sentence2: He forgot his errand, he forgot his home, and he forgot everything that had ever happened to him.

sentence2: He only knew that he wanted to remain with the Fairies all the rest of his life.

sentence2: A magic spell had been cast over him, and he became like one of themselves.
